courseStructure.title: Recognizing and Responding to Intimate Partner Violence
courseStructure.description: Comprehensive training on understanding, identifying, and responding to intimate partner violence with evidence-based frameworks and practical response strategies.
learningOutcomes: Recognize various forms of intimate partner violence including physical, emotional, sexual, and economic abuse
Analyze abusive relationship dynamics using the Power and Control Wheel framework
Understand the unique characteristics and impacts of intimate partner sexual violence
Apply trauma-informed approaches when responding to individuals experiencing IPV
Develop and facilitate safety planning strategies with survivors

modules.title: Introduction
modules.description: Foundation for understanding intimate partner violence, its prevalence, and impact on individuals and communities.
learningOutcomes: Define intimate partner violence and its key characteristics
Recognize the prevalence and societal impact of IPV

lessons.title: Introduction: What is Intimate Partner Violence?
objectives: Define intimate partner violence
Understand the scope and prevalence of IPV
Recognize why IPV awareness is critical for professionals

modules.title: MODULE 1: Recognizing Intimate Partner Violence
modules.description: In-depth exploration of the types, dynamics, and recognition of intimate partner violence using evidence-based frameworks.
learningOutcomes: Identify various types of intimate partner violence
Analyze relationship dynamics using the Power and Control Wheel
Apply IPV recognition skills to case scenarios

lessons.title: Who is Affected by Intimate Partner Violence?
objectives: Identify demographics affected by IPV
Understand statistical prevalence across populations
Recognize that IPV affects diverse communities

lessons.title: Types of Abuse
objectives: Identify and describe physical abuse
Identify and describe emotional/psychological abuse
Identify and describe economic abuse
Identify and describe sexual abuse
Recognize technological abuse

lessons.title: Power and Control Wheel
objectives: Understand the Duluth Model's Power and Control Wheel framework
Identify the eight sections of the Power and Control Wheel
Recognize how abusers use power and control tactics
Contrast with the Equality Wheel

contentBlocks.title: Introduction to Power and Control Wheel

lessons.title: Categorizing Intimate Partner Violence
objectives: Understand different patterns of IPV (situational vs. coercive control)
Recognize escalation patterns in abusive relationships
Identify risk factors for severe violence

lessons.title: Case Analysis: Lois and James Sumpter
objectives: Apply IPV recognition skills to a realistic case scenario
Identify Power and Control tactics in the case
Analyze relationship dynamics
Demonstrate critical thinking about IPV situations

moduleQuiz.title: Module 1 Quiz: Recognizing Intimate Partner Violence

modules.title: MODULE 2: Intimate Partner Sexual Violence
modules.description: Understanding sexual violence within intimate relationships, including societal context, prevalence, and unique characteristics of intimate partner sexual assault.
learningOutcomes: Define sexual violence and its forms
Understand societal factors contributing to sexual violence (rape culture)
Recognize unique aspects of sexual assault within intimate relationships
Identify myths and facts about intimate partner sexual violence

lessons.title: What is Sexual Violence?
objectives: Define sexual violence comprehensively
Identify different forms of sexual violence
Understand consent and its legal/ethical importance
Recognize sexual coercion tactics

lessons.title: Sexual Violence in Our Society
objectives: Understand the concept of rape culture
Identify societal attitudes that normalize sexual violence
Recognize the rape culture pyramid
Understand the impact of societal attitudes on survivors

lessons.title: Rape and Sexual Assault in the Context of Intimate Partner Violence
objectives: Understand prevalence of sexual violence within intimate relationships
Recognize unique dynamics of intimate partner sexual assault
Identify barriers to reporting and help-seeking
Dispel myths about marital/relationship rape

contentBlocks.title: Statistics on intimate partner sexual violence

moduleQuiz.title: Module 2 Quiz: Intimate Partner Sexual Violence

modules.title: MODULE 3: Responding to Intimate Partner Violence
modules.description: Evidence-based strategies for responding to individuals experiencing IPV, including trauma-informed approaches, safety planning, and resource connection.
learningOutcomes: Understand the multifaceted impact of IPV on victims/survivors
Apply trauma-informed principles when responding to IPV
Identify appropriate resources and referral pathways

lessons.title: The Impact of Intimate Partner Violence on Victims
objectives: Understand psychological impacts of IPV (trauma, PTSD, depression, anxiety)
Recognize physical health consequences
Identify social and economic impacts
Understand barriers to leaving abusive relationships

lessons.title: Safety Planning with Victims
objectives: Understand the purpose and importance of safety planning
Identify key components of a comprehensive safety plan
Facilitate safety planning conversations
Recognize when to involve specialized IPV advocates

lessons.title: Responding to Someone Experiencing Intimate Partner Violence. TEST
objectives: Apply trauma-informed principles (safety, trustworthiness, choice, collaboration, empowerment)
Use appropriate language and communication strategies
Identify when and how to offer resources
Recognize limitations and when to refer to specialists
Understand mandatory reporting requirements (where applicable)

moduleQuiz.title: Module 3 Quiz: Responding to Intimate Partner Violence

finalAssessment.title: ASSESSMENT: Recognizing and Responding to Intimate Partner Violence
finalAssessment.description: Comprehensive assessment covering all course content including recognition, dynamics, sexual violence, impacts, and response strategies

notes: Total extracted lessons: 18 (including quizzes and assessments)
Key frameworks to preserve: Power & Control Wheel, Equality Wheel, Rape Culture Pyramid
Case-based learning with Lois and James Sumpter case study
